cards.name: Agumon
cards.effect1: [On Play] Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 3000 DP or less.

cards.name: Biyomon
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] When this Digimon deletes one of your opponent's Digimon in battle and survives, trigger <Draw 1> (Draw 1 card from your deck).

cards.name: Gabumon
cards.effect1: [On Play] Trash the bottom digivolution card of 1 of your opponent's Digimon.

cards.name: Gomamon
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] (Once Per Turn) When one of your opponent's digivolution cards is trashed, gain 1 memory.
engsets: Digimon Card Game Fest - Vault Set
PB-09: Digimon Card Game Playmat and Card Set 2 -Floral Fun-
ruling: Q: You use an effect that reads "Return 1 of your opponent's Digimon to their hand. Trash all of the digivolution cards of that Digimon" to return an opponent's Digimon to their hand. When your opponent's digivolution cards are trashed as a result, can you activate this card's effect?

A: No, you can't. "Trash all of the digivolution cards of those Digimon" is an explanation of what happens to the digivolution cards of the Digimon when it returns to their hand. It doesn't count as trashing digivolution for the purposes of this card's effect.
Q: I use <De-Digivolve> while I have this Digimon as a digivolution card. Can I use the inherited effect of [P-004 Gomamon]?
A: No, you cannot activate the effect of [P-004 Gomamon].
Q: My opponent trashes a digivolution card with one of their effects like [BT5-111 Omnimon X] or <Digi-Burst>. Can I use this card's effect?
A: Yes, you can.

cards.name: Patamon
cards.effect1: [On Play] If you have 1 or fewer security cards, trigger <Recovery +1 (Deck)> (Place the top card of your deck on top of your security stack).

cards.name: Gatomon
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] While you have 3 or more security cards, this Digimon gets +1000 DP.

cards.name: Garurumon
cards.effect2: [When Attacking] If this Digimon has [Garurumon] in its name, trigger <Draw 1> (Draw 1 card from your deck).

cards.name: WereGarurumon
cards.effect1: [When Attacking] (Once Per Turn) If this Digimon has a [Garurumon] digivolution card, unsuspend this Digimon.
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] While you have 8 or more cards in your hand, this Digimon gains <Security Attack +1> (This Digimon checks 1 additional security card).

cards.name: Agumon
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] While this Digimon has [Greymon] in its name, it gets +2000 DP.
engsets: Digimon Card Game Fest - Vault Set

cards.name: Greymon
cards.effect1: [Your Turn] While this Digimon has an [Agumon] digivolution card, it gains <Security Attack +1> (This Digimon checks 1 additional security card).
ruling: Q: Does this card's effect apply if it has [Agumon Expert] or [ToyAgumon] as a digivolution card?

A: No. This card's effect only applies if a card with the exact name [Agumon] is one of its digivolution cards. Despite [Agumon Expert], [ToyAgumon], and other Digimon cards having [Agumon] in their names, the effect doesn't apply if it isn't an exact match.

cards.name: Veedramon Zero
cards.jpname: ブイドラモン ゼロ
cards.effect1: [When Attacking] If you have a blue Tamer, you may trash the top 3 cards of your deck to give this Digimon +2000 DP for the turn.
cards.effect2: [When Attacking] You may place 3 non-Digi-Egg cards from your trash at the bottom of your deck in any order to activate <Draw 1> (Draw 1 card from your deck).
ruling: Q: Do I always have to use this card's effect when I attack?
A: No. The effect is voluntary.
Q: Can I use this card's [When Attacking] effect to trash 6 cards from the top of my deck and give this card +4000 DP?
A: No, you can't.

Q: I attack with this card and activate its [When Attacking] effect to get +2000 DP. I then unsuspend this card using a card effect and attack again. Can I use the [When Attacking] effect again to get an additional +2000 DP?
A: Yes, you can.
Q: Can I activate this card's inherited effect when I have 2 or less non-Digi-Egg cards in my trash?
A: No, you can't.
Q: When using this card's inherited effect to return cards from my trash to the bottom of my deck, is my opponent allowed to check what cards I am returning to my deck?
A: Yes. Cards in your trash are considered public information, so please let your opponent confirm which cards you're returning to your deck before you do so.
Q: Can I use this card's inherited effect to return 3 non-Digi-Egg cards to the bottom of my deck but not activate <Draw 1>?
A: No, you can't.

cards.name: Tai Kamiya (V-Tamer)
cards.jpname: 八神太一（デジモンアドベンチャー Vテイマー01）
cards.effect1:
[Main] If you have a Digimon with [Veedramon] in its name, you may suspend this Tamer to activate one of the following effects:
・Trigger <Draw 1> (Draw 1 card from your deck).
・1 of your Digimon gets +1000 DP for the turn.
cards.effect2: [Security] Play this card without paying its memory cost.
ruling: Q: At what timing does this card's [Main] effect activate?
A: You can activate it at any time during your Main Phase, much like you would an Option card.
Q: Can I use this card's effect if I have a Digimon [Veedramon] in its name in my breeding area?
A: No, it doesn't check Digimon in the breeding area.
Q: If I have two copies of this Tamer as well as one [Veedramon] in play in my battle area, can I active the effects of both Tamers?
A: Yes, you can.
Q: If I have one [Veedramon] in play in my battle area, can I use this card's effect to make a Digimon that doesn't have [Veedramon] in its name get +1000 DP?
A: Yes, you can.

cards.name: Keramon
cards.effect2: [Opponent's Turn] This Digimon gets +1000 DP.

cards.name: Kurisarimon
cards.effect1:
<Blocker> (When an opponent's Digimon attacks, you may suspend this Digimon to force the opponent to attack it instead).
 [When Attacking] Lose 2 memory.

cards.name: Infermon
cards.effect1: [On Play] Trigger <De-Digivolve  1> on 1 of your opponent's Digimon (Trash up to 1 card from the top of one of your opponent's Digimon. If it has no digivolution cards, or becomes a level 3 Digimon, you can't trash any more cards).

cards.name: Diaboromon
cards.effect1: [Your Turn] For each [Diaboromon] you have in play, this Digimon gets <Security Attack +1> (This Digimon checks 1 additional security card).
engsets: Digimon Card Game Fest - Vault Set
ruling: Q: Does a [Diaboromon] Token count as 1 [Diaboromon] for this card's effect?
A: Yes, it does.
Q: Does this card itself count as 1 [Diaboromon] for its effect?
A: Yes, it does.

cards.name: DemiDevimon
cards.effect1: [On Play] Trash the top 2 cards of your deck.
ruling: Q: Do I always have to activate this card's effect?
A: Yes, as long as you are able to.

cards.name: Devimon
cards.effect1: [On Play] Delete 1 of your opponent's level 3 Digimon.

cards.name: Myotismon
cards.effect2: <Retaliation> (When this Digimon is deleted after losing a battle, delete the Digimon it was battling).

cards.name: VenomMyotismon
cards.jpname: ヴェノムヴァンデモン
cards.effect1: [On Deletion] You may play a purple Digimon Card with a level of 4 or less from your trash without paying its memory cost. Any [On Play] effects on Digimon played with this effect don't activate.

cards.name: A New World
cards.effect1: [Main] If you have [Mimi Tachikawa] in play, you may play a [Palmon] from your hand without paying its memory cost to return 1 of your [Mimi Tachikawa] cards to it's owner's hand.
cards.effect2: [Security] Add this card to your hand.
ruling: Q: If I have a [Mimi Tachikawa] in play. Is the effect of this card that I can play a [Palmon] from my hand without paying its cost?
A: Yes, that's correct.

cards.name: DNA Digivolution - Hearts United
cards.jpname: ジョグレス進化 今、心をひとつに
cards.tsname: Jogress Evolution Now, Unite Our Hearts
cards.effect1: [Main] If you have [Davis Motomiya] and [Ken Ichijoji] in play, you may place 1 [ExVeemon] and 1 [Stingmon] from your hand at the bottom of your deck in any order to play 1 [Paildramon] from your hand without paying its memory cost.
cards.effect2: [Security] Add this card to your hand.
ruling: Q: Can I use this card when I only have either "XV-mon" or "Stingmon" in my hand?

A: Yes, uou can use it, but unless you return both a [ExVeemon] and [Stingmon] from your hand to the bottom of the deck, you cannot play [Paildramon] without paying its cost. Also, it is not possible to return only one of [ExVeemon] and [Stingmon] to the bottom of the deck.

cards.name: Patamon's Confession
cards.effect1: [Main] If you have [T.K. Takaishi] in play, place 1 of your [Patamon] at the bottom of your security stack face down. Trash that Digimon's digivolution cards.
cards.effect2: [Security] Add this card to your hand.
ruling: Q: Can I use this card when I don't have [Patamon] in play?
A: You can use it, but you cannot put anything in your security.

cards.name: Tai's Growing Up!
cards.jpname: 太一、おっきくなったね
cards.effect1: [Main] If you have [Tai Kamiya] in play, place 1 of your [Agumon] at the bottom of its owner's deck to trigger <Draw 3> (Draw 3 cards from your deck). Trash that Digimon's digivolution cards.
cards.effect2: [Security] Add this card to your hand.
ruling: Q: Can I use this card's effect with [P-012 Tai Kamiya (V-Tamer)] in play?
A: No, it must be a card named [Tai Kamiya].
Q: Can I return a card with [Agumon] in its name such as [ToyAgumon], [Agumon Expert], or [BushiAgumon]?
A: No, it must be a card named [Agumon].
Q: Can I place an [Agumon] from my hand on the bottom of my deck for this card's effect?
A: No, it must be from the battle area.

cards.name: GranKuwagamon
cards.effect1:
[Main] <Digi-Burst 2> (You may trash 2 of this Digimon's digivolution cards to activate the effect below).
・1 of your digimon gains <Security Attack +1> (This Digimon checks 1 additional security card) for the turn.

cards.name: BlackWarGreymon
cards.jpname: ブラックウォーグレイモン
cards.effect1:
[Main] <Digi-Burst 2> (You may trash 2 of this Digimon's digivolution cards to activate the effect below).
・Unsuspend this Digimon.
ruling: Q: Can I use this card's <Digi-Burst> effect after I digivolved this card on a suspended Digimon and the memory becomes 1 or more on the opponent's side?
A: No, you cannot.

cards.name: MetalGarurumon
cards.effect1:
[Main] <Digi-Burst 2> (You may trash 2 of this Digimon's digivolution cards to activate the effect below).
・Use a purple Option card with a memory cost of 7 or less in your hand without paying its memory cost.
ruling: Q: Does this card's <Digi-Burst> effect trigger [BT3-096 Mimi Tachikawa]?
A: Yes, it does.

Q: I have a [BT3-091 Lilithmon] and [BT3-092 MaloMyotismon] and then I use this card's effect to <Digi-Burst> [BT4-077 Ghostmon], what is the order of the effects when I use [BT2-109 Heat Viper] with this card?
A: The order of effects goes [BT3-092 MaloMyotismon] and then [BT4-077 Ghostmon] or [BT3-091 Lilithmon].

cards.name: Pulsemon
cards.effect1: [On Play] If you have 3 or more security cards, trigger <Draw 1> (Draw 1 card from your deck). If you have 3 or fewer security cards, gain 1 memory.
engsets: Bandai TCG Online Lobby Test Events
Digimon Card Game Fest - Vault Set
ruling: Q: If I have exactly 3 cards in Security do I get to use both effects to <Draw 1> and gain +1 memory?
A: Yes, if you have exactly 3 security cards it satisfies both the conditions of <Draw 1> and +1 Memory.

cards.name: Agunimon
cards.effect1: [When Attacking] This Digimon can digivolve into an [AncientGreymon] in your hand for a memory cost of 2, ignoring its digivolution requirements. If it does, delete this Digimon at the end of the turn.
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] When digivolving this Digimon into an [AncientGreymon] in your hand, reduce its digivolution cost by 2.
ruling: Q: After using this card's [When Attacking] effect to digivolve into [AncientGreymon]. The Digimon digivolves or <De-Digivolve> into another Digimon. Does it still get deleted at the end of the turn?
A: Yes, the effect to delete the Digimon at the end of the turn persists.

Q: After using this card's [When Attacking] effect to digivolve into [AncientGreymon] and then using [BT5-109 Mega Digimon Fusion!] to digivolve into a level 7 Digimon. Since the deletion effect persists, what happens first?

A: Since the "delete this Digimon" and "return the Digimon to the bottom of its owner's deck" trigger at the same time. The player chooses which effect goes first. The effect that happens after is not applied.
Q: After using [BT3-109 Back for Revenge!] on this Digimon, it then digivolves into [AncientGreymon]. Which Digimon will be played by this effect [P-029 Agunimon] or [AncientGreymon]?
A: The effect of [BT3-109 Back for Revenge!] will persist on the evolved Digimon. So the [AncientGreymon] is played.

Q: After using [BT6-104 Parabolic Junk] on this Digimon. I then uses its [When Attacking] to digivolve into [AncientGreymon] putting the memory at 1 on the opponent's side. My opponent has a Digimon with [ST5-04 ToyAgumon] in its digivolution cards. What happens?

A: After the attack ends, the End of Turn Procedures will start and this Digimon will get deleted bringing the memory back 1 on your side. After the opponent resolves [ST5-04 ToyAgumon]'s [End of Opponent's Turn] effect you continue your turn. You would end your turn twice so [End of Your Turn], [End of Opponent's Turn], and [End of All Turns] would trigger twice this turn.
Q: If I am activating this card's [When Attacking] effect to digivolve, can I reduce its digivolution cost of that effect?
A: Yes, you can reduce the digivolution cost of 2 with another effect.

cards.name: Lobomon
cards.effect1: [When Digivolving] This Digimon can digivolve into an [AncientGarurumon] in your hand for a memory cost of 1, ignoring its digivolution requirements. If it does, delete this Digimon at the end of the turn.
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] When digivolving this Digimon into an [AncientGarurumon] in your hand, reduce its digivolution cost by 2.
ruling: Q: After using this card's [When Digivolving] effect to digivolve into [AncientGarurumon]. The Digimon digivolves or <De-Digivolve> into another Digimon. Does it still get deleted at the end of the turn?
A: Yes, the effect to delete the Digimon at the end of the turn persists.

Q: After using this card's [When Digivolving] effect to digivolve into [AncientGarurumon] and then using [BT5-109 Mega Digimon Fusion!] to digivolve into a level 7 Digimon. Since the deletion effect persists, what happens first?

A: Since the "delete this Digimon" and "return the Digimon to the bottom of its owner's deck" trigger at the same time. The player chooses which effect goes first. The effect that happens after is not applied.

Q: After using [BT3-109 Back for Revenge!] on a Digimon, that Digimon then digivolves into [P-030 Lobomon] and then [AncientGarurumon]. Which Digimon will be played by this effect [P-030 Lobomon] or [AncientGarurumon]?
A: The effect of [BT3-109 Back for Revenge!] will persist on the evolved Digimon. So the [AncientGarurumon] is played.

Q: I digivolve [BT1-030 Gomamon] into [P-030 Lobomon]. The memory passes over to 1 when I use the latter's effect to digivolve into [BT4-114 AncientGarurumon]. My opponent has a Digimon with [ST5-04 ToyAgumon] in its digivolution cards. As my turn is ending, AncientGarurumon is deleted and [BT1-030 Gomamon]'s effect gives me +1 memory moving my memory back to 0. What happens?

A: Even though End of Turn Procedures have started, when your memory moves back to 0, you no longer continue ending your turn, [End of Your Turn], [End of Opponent's Turn], and [End of All Turns] would happen twice in this instance as you would end your turn twice.
Q: If I am using this card's [When Digivolving] effect to digivolve, can I reduce its digivolution cost of that effect?
A: Yes, you can reduce the digivolution cost of 1 with another effect.

cards.name: Gatomon
cards.effect1:
[Opponent's Turn] While you have a purple Digimon in play, this Digimon gains <Blocker> (When an opponent's Digimon attacks, you may suspend this Digimon to force the opponent to attack it instead).
[On Play] If you have 3 or fewer security cards, trigger <Recovery +1 (Deck)> (Place the top card of your deck on top of your security stack).
ruling: Q: If I have a purple Digimon and this card in play. If my opponent uses a [When Attacking] effect to delete the purple Digimon can this Digimon still use <Blocker> to block the attack?
A: No, this Digimon did not have <Blocker> at the [Reaction] timing. So it cannot use <Blocker>. (See more in Attack Resolution)

cards.name: Palmon
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] When this card is trashed due to activating this Digimon's <Digi-Burst>, 1 of your Digimon gains <Jamming> (This Digimon can't be deleted in battles against Security Digimon) for the turn.
engsets: Digimon Card Game Fest - Vault Set

cards.name: Sunarizamon
cards.effect1: [Your Turn] All of your black Digimon with 13000 DP or more gain <Piercing> (When this Digimon attacks and deletes an opponent's Digimon and survives the battle, it performs any security checks it normally would).
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] While this Digimon is black and has 13000 DP or more, this Digimon gains <Security Attack +1> (This Digimon checks 1 additional security card).
ruling: Q: This Digimon is in play, my Black Digimon with 12000 DP attacks and uses its [When Attacking] effect to gain +1000 DP. Can that Digimon activate <Piercing> in that attack?
A: Yes, when your opponent's Digimon is deleted by battle your Digimon will have <Piercing> so it can be activated. (See more in Attack Resolution)

Q: This Digimon is a digivolution card of my Black Digimon with 12000 DP that attacks and uses its [When Attacking] effect to gain +1000 DP. Can that Digimon activate <Security Attack +1> for that attack?
A: Yes, when you check security it will have <Security Attack +1>. (See more in Attack Resolution)

Q: While my Black Digimon with 13000 DP is checking security with this card in its digivolution cards it is hit by a [Security] effect that <De-Digivolve> it to a Digimon with 12000 DP or less. What happens to the <Security Attack +1>?
A: The Digimon loses the <Security Attack +1> and if no other effects are increasing its security attack no further checks will be performed and the attack will end.

cards.name: DemiDevimon
cards.effect2: [On Deletion] If you have 7 or more Digimon cards with [Devimon] in their name in your trash, you may play 1 [DanDevimon] from your trash without paying its memory cost.
ruling: Q: My Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards is deleted when I have 6 Digimon cards with [Devimon] in its name. Can I play a [DanDevimon] from my trash with this card's effect?

A: Yes, when you activate this effect you will have 7 or more Digimon cards with [Devimon] in their name in the trash, the [On Deletion] inherited effect be able to play a [DanDevimon] from your trash without paying its memory cost.

cards.name: Red Memory Boost!
cards.jpname: レッド・メモリブースト！！
cards.effect1:
[Main] Reveal the top 4 cards of your deck. Add 1 red Digimon card among them to your hand. Place the remaining cards at the bottom of your deck in any order. Then, place this card in your battle area.
[Main] <Delay> (Trash this card in your battle area to activate the effect below. You can't activate this effect the turn this card enters play.)
・Gain 2 memory.
cards.effect2: [Security] Place this card in its owner's battle area.
ruling: Q: If this card is in my battle area, can I play Red Options even though I do not have a Red Digimon or Tamer in my battle area or breeding area?
A: No, this card in the battle area does not meet the colour requirement for you to play Red Options.
Q: Can I activate this card's <Delay> effect even if there is no Red Digimon or Tamer in my battle area or breeding area?
A: Yes, the colour requirement for Options is only applied when using Option cards from your hand.

cards.name: Blue Memory Boost!
cards.jpname: ブルー・メモリブースト！！
cards.effect1:
[Main] Reveal the top 4 cards of your deck. Add 1 blue Digimon card among them to your hand. Place the remaining cards at the bottom of your deck in any order. Then, place this card in your battle area.
[Main] <Delay> (Trash this card in your battle area to activate the effect below. You can't activate this effect the turn this card enters play.)
・Gain 2 memory.
cards.effect2: [Security] Place this card in its owner's battle area.
ruling: Q: If this card is in my battle area, can I play Blue Options even though I do not have a Blue Digimon or Tamer in my battle area or breeding area?
A: No, this card in the battle area does not meet the colour requirement for you to play Blue Options.
Q: Can I activate this card's <Delay> effect even if there is no Blue Digimon or Tamer in my battle area or breeding area?
A: Yes, the colour requirement for Options is only applied when using Option cards from your hand.

cards.effect2: [Security] Place this card in its owner's battle area.

[Main] <Delay> (Trash this card in your battle area to activate the effect below. You can't activate this effect the turn this card enters play.)

[Main] <Delay> (Trash this card in your battle area to activate the effect below. You can't activate this effect the turn this card enters play.)

cards.effect2: [Security] Place this card in its owner's battle area.
ruling: Q: If this card is in my battle area, can I play Black Options even though I do not have a Black Digimon or Tamer in my battle area or breeding area?

Q: Can I activate this card's <Delay> effect even if there is no Black Digimon or Tamer in my battle area or breeding area?

[Main] <Delay> (Trash this card in your battle area to activate the effect below. You can't activate this effect the turn this card enters play.)

Q: Can I activate this card's <Delay> effect even if there is no Purple Digimon or Tamer in my battle area or breeding area?

cards.name: Guilmon
cards.effect1: [When Attacking] Trigger <Draw 1> (Draw 1 card from your deck).

cards.name: Gabumon
cards.effect1: [On Play] Reveal the top 5 cards of your deck. Add 1 Tamer card among them to your hand. Place the cards at the bottom of your deck in any order.

cards.name: Kudamon
cards.effect1: [On Play] You may return 1 [Kentaurosmon] from your trash to the bottom of your deck to trigger <Recovery +1 (Deck)> (Place the top card of your deck on top of your security stack).
cards.effect2: [On Deletion] 1 of your opponent's Digimon gets -1000 DP for the turn.

cards.name: HerculesKabuterimon
cards.jpname: ヘラクルカブテリモン
cards.effect1: [When Digivolving] Suspend 1 of your opponent's Digimon, or 2 of your opponent's Digimon with 5000 DP or less.

cards.name: Kurisarimon
cards.effect2: [All Turns] All of your other Digimon with the same name as this Digimon gain <Decoy (Black/White)> (When one of your other black or white Digimon would be deleted by an opponent's effect, you may delete this Digimon to prevent that deletion).

cards.name: Wizardmon
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] (Once Per Turn) When you use an option card, gain 1 memory.
engsets: Digimon Card Game Fest - Vault Set

cards.name: AeroVeedramon Zero
cards.jpname: エアロブイドラモン ゼロ
cards.effect1: [When Digivolving] Trash the top 3 cards of your deck. Then, if you have a Tamer in play, this Digimon gets +3000 DP for the turn.
cards.effect2: [When Attacking] You may place 3 non Digi-Egg cards from your trash at the bottom of your deck in any order to give this Digimon +2000 DP for the turn.

cards.name: UlforceVeedramon Zero
cards.jpname: アルフォースブイドラモン ゼロ
cards.effect1:
[When Digivolving] You may place 3 non Digi-Egg cards from your trash at the bottom of your deck in any order to unsuspend this Digimon and 1 of your Tamers.
[Your Turn] (Once Per Turn) When a card is returned from your trash to your deck, gain 1 memory.
ruling: Q: If a card is returned to my Digi-Egg Deck, does this card's [Your Turn] effect activate?
A: No, the deck and the Digi-Egg deck are considered separate.

cards.name: Phoenixmon
cards.effect1:
[When Digivolving] If you have a Tamer in play, this Digimon gains <Security Attack +1> (This Digimon checks 1 additional security card) for the turn.
[Your Turn] (Once Per Turn) When this Digimon is blocked, trash the top card of your opponent's security stack.

cards.name: WarGreymon
cards.effect1:
[When Digivolving] If you have a Tamer in play, delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 13000 DP or more. 
[When Attacking] Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 4000 DP or less

cards.name: MetalGarurumon
cards.effect1:
[When Digivolving] If you have a Tamer in play, <Draw 2> (Draw 2 cards from your deck).
[Opponent's Turn] This Digimon can't be attacked.

cards.name: Vikemon
cards.effect1:
[When Digivolving] If you have a Tamer in play, up to 3 of your opponent's Digimon with no digivolution cards can't attack until the end of your opponent's next turn.
[When Attacking] (Once Per Turn) Return 1 of your opponent's Digimon with no digivolution cards to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Ophanimon
cards.effect1:
[When Digivolving] If you have a Tamer in play, 1 of your opponent's Digimon gets -5000 DP for the turn.
[When Attacking] 1 of your opponent's Digimon and all of your opponent's Security Digimon get -2000 DP for the turn.

cards.name: Seraphimon
cards.effect1:
[When Digivolving] If you have a Tamer in play, <Recovery +1 (Deck)> (Place the top card of your deck on top of your security stack).
[On Deletion] <Recovery +1 (Deck)> (Place the top card of your deck on top of your security stack).

cards.name: HerculesKabuterimon
cards.jpname: ヘラクルカブテリモン
cards.effect1:
[When Digivolving] If you have a Tamer in play, suspend 1 of your opponent's Digimon. 
[Your Turn] When this Digimon deletes an opponent's Digimon in battle and survives, gain 1 memory.

cards.name: Rosemon
cards.effect1:
<Digisorption -2> (When one of your Digimon digivolves into this card from your hand, you may suspend 1 of your Digimon to reduce the memory cost of the digivolution by 2)
[When Digivolving] If you have a Tamer in play, 1 of your opponent's Digimon can't attack or block until the end of their next turn.

cards.name: Tyrannomon
cards.effect1: [Your Turn] This Digimon gets +3000 DP
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] While this Digimon is level 6 or higher, it gets +2000 DP.

cards.name: Gammamon
cards.effect1: [Your Turn] While you have a red Tamer in play, this Digimon can attack your opponent's unsuspended Digimon.

cards.name: Gammamon
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] While you have a [Hiro Amanokawa] in play, this Digimon gets +2000 DP.

cards.name: Angoramon
cards.effect2: [When Attacking] (Once Per Turn) If you have a [Ruli Tsukiyono] in play, gain 1 memory.

cards.name: Jellymon
cards.effect2: [When Attacking] (Once Per Turn) If you have a [Kiyoshiro Higashimitarai] in play, <Draw 1> (Draw 1 card from your deck).

cards.name: Hiro Amanokawa
cards.effect1: [Your Turn] When you attack with a Digimon that has [Gammamon] in its digivolution cards, you may suspend this Tamer to give that Digimon <Security Attack +1> (This Digimon checks 1 additional security card) for the turn.
cards.effect2: [Security] Play this card without paying its memory cost.

cards.name: Ruli Tsukiyono
cards.effect1: [Your Turn] When you attack with a Digimon that has [Angoramon] in its digivolution cards, you may suspend this Tamer to have that Digimon get +3000 DP for the turn.
cards.effect2: [Security] Play this card without paying its memory cost.

cards.name: Kiyoshiro Higashimitarai
cards.effect1: [Your Turn] When you attack with a Digimon that has [Jellymon] in its digivolution cards, you may suspend this Tamer to have that Digimon gain <Jamming> (This Digimon can't be deleted in battles against Security Digimon) for the turn.
cards.effect2: [Security] Play this card without paying its memory cost.

cards.name: Gammamon
cards.effect1: [On Play] Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 2000 DP or less.
cards.effect2: [When Attacking] Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 2000 DP or less.
jpsets: ST-11: Starter Deck Special Entry Deck

cards.name: Huckmon
cards.effect1: [Security] At the end of the battle, delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 4000 DP or less. If you don't delete an opponent's Digimon with this effect, <Draw 1> (Draw 1 card from your deck). Then, add this card to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Bulucomon
cards.effect1: [Security] At the end of the battle, <Draw 2> (Draw 2 cards from your deck). Then, add this card to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Herissmon
cards.effect1: [Security] At the end of the battle, 1 of your opponent's Digimon gains <Security Attack -1> (This Digimon checks 1 fewer security card) for the turn. Then, add this card to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Pulsemon
cards.effect1: [Security] At the end of the battle, suspend 1 of your opponent's Digimon. Then, add this card to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Dorumon
cards.effect1: [Security] At the end of the battle, reveal the top card of your deck. If that card is a black Digimon card with a play cost of 4 or less, you may play it without paying its memory cost. Add any remaining cards to your hand. Then, add this card to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Impmon
cards.effect1: [Security] At the end of the battle, you may play 1 purple level 3 Digimon card from your trash without paying its memory cost. Then, add this card to its owner's hand.

cards.name: MetalGreymon: Alterous Mode
cards.jpname: メタルグレイモン：アルタラウスモード
cards.effect1:
The name of this card/Digimon is also treated as [MetalGreymon].
[When Digivolving] If you have a Tamer in play, delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 5000 DP or less.
cards.effect2: [All Turns] While this Digimon with [Greymon], or [Omnimon] in its name and an effect would delete it or return it to your hand or deck, you may trash 2 cards of the same level in this Digimon's digivolution cards to prevent it from leaving play.

cards.name: WereGarurumon: Sagittarius Mode
cards.jpname: ワーガルルモン：サジタリウスモード
cards.effect1:
The name of this card/Digimon is also treated as [WereGarurumon].
[When Digivolving] If you have a Tamer in play, return 2 of your opponent's level 3 Digimon to their owner's hand.
cards.effect2: [All Turns] When this Digimon has [Garurumon], or [Omnimon] in its name and would be deleted in battle, you may trash 2 cards of the same level in this Digimon's digivolution cards to prevent that deletion.

cards.name: Boutmon
cards.effect1: [Your Turn] When this Digimon would digivolve into a card with [Shaman], or [Wizard] in its traits, you may trash up to 3 cards from the top of your security stack. For each security card trashed by this effect, reduce the digivolution cost by 1.
cards.effect2: [When Attacking] (Once Per Turn) If you have 3 security cards, unsuspend this Digimon.

cards.name: Okuwamon
cards.effect1: [Your Turn] When this Digimon would digivolve into a card with [Insectoid] in its traits, all of your opponent's Digimon gain "[All Turns] When this Digimon becomes suspended, lose 1 memory." until the end of your opponent's turn.
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] While this Digimon has [Insectoid] in its traits, it gains <Piercing> (When this Digimon attacks and deletes an opponent's Digimon and survives the battle, it performs any security checks it normally would).

cards.name: Deltamon
cards.effect1: [Your Turn] When this Digimon would digivolve into a card with 2 colors or [Composite] in its traits, reduce the digivolution cost by 2.
cards.effect2: [When Attacking] For each of this Digimon’s colors, delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 3000 DP or less.

cards.name: Wizardmon
cards.effect1: When this card is trashed from your Deck, gain 1 memory.
cards.effect2: [When Attacking] You may reveal 1 purple card from your hand and place it on top of your deck.

cards.name: Agumon
cards.effect1: [On Play] If you have a red Tamer in play, delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 3000 DP or less.
wwsets: Digimon Survive Release Commemorative Promotion Pack

cards.name: Labramon
cards.effect1: [On Play] If you have a purple Tamer in play, delete 1 of your opponent's level 3 Digimon.
wwsets: Digimon Survive Release Commemorative Promotion Pack

cards.name: Falcomon
cards.effect1: [On Play] If you have a yellow Tamer in play, 1 of your opponent's Digimon gets -2000 DP until the end of their turn.
wwsets: Digimon Survive Release Commemorative Promotion Pack
